synopsis: In this engaging episode of Pineapple Blot Rotation, hosts Devam and Ahir, alongside special guest Garrett, dive deep into the complex relationship between body image and gym culture. They explore personal experiences, the impact of social media, and the importance of fostering a positive mindset towards fitness and self-acceptance.
quotes: The horror is persist, but so do we.
You can’t change your height, but you can change how you feel about yourself.
If you’re going to the gym to improve the way you look, you should also be going because you enjoy it.
You are not entitled to love based on how you look; it’s who you are as a person that matters.
Comparison is the thief of joy.
If you don’t like going to the gym, don’t go! Find something active that you enjoy.
Everyone is trying their best; we all have our struggles.
If you’re going to the gym purely based on negative emotions, that’s not a healthy relationship.
Drink more water; it can change your life!
Your body image should be about self-acceptance, not just self-improvement.
